name: JMeter

name: single-spa
description: single-spa is a JavaScript framework for bringing together multiple micro frontends in a single front-end application. Although we advise against micro frontend anarchy
column6: the use of micro frontends as an excuse to mix and match multiple frameworks
column7: single-spa supports just that. We understand that there are legitimate scenarios such as upgrading to a new revision of a framework across multiple micro frontends where integration across multiple frameworks is necessary. single-spa has been a go-to framework for micro frontend integration for our teams
column8: and they're finding it to work well with SystemJS and managing different versions of a single dependency.

name: Azure DevOps
description: Azure DevOps services contain a set of managed services
column9: backlog management tooling and artifact repository. We've seen our teams getting more experience in using this platform with good results
column10: which means Azure DevOps is maturing. We particularly like its flexibility; it allows you to use the services you want even if they're from different providers. For instance
column11: you could use an external Git repository while still using the Azure DevOps pipeline services. Our teams are especially excited about Azure DevOps Pipelines. Nevertheless
column12: all the services offer a good developer experience that helps our teams deliver value.

name: Splunk
description: Splunk Cloud Platform compatible with opentelemetry and able to build application map which GCP monitor cannot do
